***** Translingual[edit] *****

English Wikipedia has an article on:
Nya_(Indic)
Wikipedia
**** Pronunciation[edit] ****
    * IPA(key): /ɲə/ (may vary by language)
**** Letter[edit] ****
ञ (ña)
   1. Devanagari letter.
*** See also[edit] ***
Ligatures:
    * ज्ञ (jña): ज + ञ
***** Dhivehi[edit] *****
**** Pronunciation[edit] ****
    * IPA(key): [ɲə]
**** Letter[edit] ****
ञ • (ñə)
   1. The twentieth consonant in Dhivehi, written in Devanagari
***** Hindi[edit] *****
**** Pronunciation[edit] ****
    * IPA(key): /ɲə/
**** Letter[edit] ****
ञ • (ña)
   1. the tenth consonant in Hindi, used in Sanskrit loanwords

***** Marathi[edit] *****
**** Pronunciation[edit] ****
    * IPA(key): /jə̃/
**** Letter[edit] ****
ञ • (ña)
   1. The tenth consonant in Marathi.
***** Nepali[edit] *****
**** Pronunciation[edit] ****
    * (phoneme) IPA(key): [nʌ]
    * Phonetic Devanagari: न
    * (letter name) IPA(key): [jʌ̃]
    * Phonetic Devanagari: यँ
**** Letter[edit] ****
ञ • (ña)
   1. The tenth consonant in Nepali.

***** Newar[edit] *****
**** Alternative forms[edit] ****
    * (Dolakhae) ङ (ṅa)
**** Etymology[edit] ****
From Proto-Sino-Tibetan *s-ŋja.
**** Noun[edit] ****
ञ • (ña) ? (Newa Spelling 𑐘)
   1. (Kathmandu) fish
